intro: Nemophila inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces flowers in early spring. Nemophila inaequalis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and naturalized areas.
